Head of the repair and restoration base

Duties: management of the repair and restoration base (30 employees)
summaryText:
I am seeking to be a part of a friendly and professional team where I can develop my skills in creating and maintaining user interfaces with a variety of functionality, while being a valuable member of the team by utilising and expanding my current skill set.
I am particularly interested in working with React, JavaScript, and Material UI. I continue to do server development using Node.js, Express.js, Socket.IO MongoDB.
My immediate goals are to learn new development tools and technologies, as well as undertaking practical work with database management systems
chatTechnologies: Technologies used: React, Redux-toolkit, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Vite, MUI, Postman, MongoDB, NodeJS, Express, Socket.IO, Git, Responsive web Design
chatDescription: Description: Chat with the ability to add, edit and delete messages and photos. Realized registration, changing the avatar and password, deleting the user and all his messages.
pharmacyTechnologies: Technologies used: React, Redux-toolkit, React-router, React Testing Library, JEST, Axios, Formik, Yup, HTML, SCSS, JavaScript, Vite, MUI, Postman, MongoDB, NodeJS, Express, Cloudinary, Git, Responsive web Design
pharmacyDescription: Description: an online pharmacy with registration and the availability of a personal office. Functional: product filtering by categories, price, form, etc.; product reviews; purchase of goods with receipt of a confirmation letter by mail; chat with a pharmacist; adding products to Favorites and Cart; reviewed and promotional items
pharmacyRole: Role in the project: creation of a page and logic of displaying products by category, formation of a product request line, product filtering by parameters, saving the filtering parameters in the URL (searchParams), pagination
carmapTechnologies: Technologies used: React, JavaScript, CSS, Postman, MongoDB, Node.js, Express.js
carmapDescription: Description: test task. A map with announcements is integrated into the project. The ability to add, edit, delete ads has been implemented; information is stored in MongoDB, thanks to the self-written server part of the project
hierarchyTechnologies: Technologies used: React, React-router, Hooks, JavaScript, CSS, Vite
hierarchyDescription: Description: test task. An application with the following hierarchical structure of pages (tables): Accounts => Profiles => Campaigns. Three clickable tables, which, when you click on one of the rows, move according to the structure to the selected entity. Sorting, filtering and pagination have been implemented for each of the tables
commentsTechnologies: Technologies used: React, Hooks, JavaScript, CSS, Vite
commentsDescription: Description: test task. Implemented the ability to add and delete posts. You can add comments to each post and choose a color identification for the comment. The number of comments made is displayed next to each post
shopTechnologies: Technologies used: React, Hooks, Redux, Redux-thunk, React-router, React Testing Library, JEST, Fetch, Formik, Yup, HTML, SCSS, JavaScript, Responsive web Design
shopDescription: Description: web page of the online store with the ability to add and remove products to Favorites and Cart (separate pages). The opportunity to purchase goods by filling out the form. Switching display of products in the form of cards or of a table
independentRole: Role in the project: independent project development
cardsTechnologies: Technologies used: HTML, SCSS, JS, Fetch, Gulp, Responsive web Design, REST API
cardsDescription: Description: page where create, edit, and delete cards that describe scheduled doctor visits. Cards are stored on the server, visits are filtered by urgency, choice of doctor or purpose of the visit
forkioTechnologies: Technologies used: HTML, SCSS, JavaScript, Gulp, Responsive web Design
forkioDescription: Description: the site was created taking into account the principles of adaptive layout. The project build is configured using Gulp
humDescription: Description: the site is designed only for wide-format monitors with a screen width of 1200 pixels or more
